com.brightcove.player.view
Class BrightcoveVideoView

java.lang.Object
  FrameLayout
      com.brightcove.player.view.BrightcoveVideoView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component
@Emits(events={"didChangeList","didSelectSource","pause","play","prebufferNextVideo","readyToPlay","seekTo","selectSource","setSource","setVideo","stop","willChangeVideo"})
@ListensFor(events={"bufferedUpdate","completed","seekTo","didSeekTo","didSetSource","pause","didPlay","progress","sourceNotPlayable","stop","videoDurationChanged","willChangeVideo","willInterruptContent"})
public class BrightcoveVideoView
extends FrameLayout
implements Component

BrightcoveVideoView is designed to be dropped into your XML layouts as a replacement for Android's native VideoView. It provides public methods to mirror that of VideoView, plus additional. It is designed to use the EventEmitter flow, and contains within it VideoDisplayComponent and VideoPlayController

See Also:
EventEmitter, VideoDisplayComponent, VideoPlaybackController, android.widget.VideoView

setMediaController

public void setMediaController(MediaController mediaController)
Used to attach a valid MediaController implementation to our view. If the view's parent is an instance of View, it will be used as the anchor. Otherwise, the BrightcoveVideoView will be used as the anchor.

Parameters:
controller -

setMediaController

public void setMediaController(MediaController mediaController,
                               View anchorView,
                               MediaPlayerControl mediaPlayerControl)
Used to attach a valid MediaController implementation to our view. The provided anchorView and mediaPlayerControl will replace existing values and can be null.

Parameters:

mediaPlayerControl -
